newsitem.title: USA: Los Angeles funds tranfer hurt rail projects - audit.
newsitem.headline: Los Angeles funds tranfer hurt rail projects - audit.

text.p: The diversion of Los Angeles County Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) funds added to a $300 million shortfall in the local rail construction budget, according to an audit released on Monday.
In October 1995, California's governor approved a bill authorizing the transfer of $50 million of MTA funds to Los Angeles County to help the county balance its budget in fiscal year 1995-1996.
The MTA used funds intended for its rail construction projects to replace the $50 million diverted from its bus operations to the county, California state Auditor Kurt Sjoberg said in his audit.
"The diversion of the $50 million added to an existing shortfall of more than $300 million in funding for MTA's rail construction projects," the auditor said.
